raw_data.prompt:
You will be given a batch of 10 samples. Each sample contains a conversation between User and a dialogue System.

Your task is to assign a float score to the sample on one metric.

You should carefully horizontally compare the given samples in order to assign a suitable float score to each sample.

Please make sure you read and understand these instructions carefully. Please keep this document open while reviewing, and refer to it as needed.


Evaluation Criteria:

Understanding (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Does the system seem to understand the user?
- A float score near 1 (not understanding) means that the system completely fails to understand the user's needs or questions. This could be manifested as the system providing answers that are irrelevant to the user's question, or the system's response completely deviating from the topic.
- A float score near 2 (somewhat understanding) means the system's response is partially correct or related to the question, but does not fully answer the user's question.
- A float score near 3 (very understanding) means that the system fully understands the user's needs or question, and provides an accurate, relevant answer.


Conversations to be evaluated:



Sample1:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi! How are you? :D
User: Good good
System: That's good to hear. :D
User: what are you doing now?
System: I'm listening to music. :D How about you?
User: I'm chatting with System
System: Cool! :D Whatcha chatting about? :D
User: About what we are doing XD
System: Cool! :D How was your day?
User: It was good. Just worked for one day, a bit tired
System: Ah, that's always fun. How long have you been working there?
User: 3 years
System: Wow, that's a long time. :)
User: Yeah it is. But maybe I'll be here longer, sadly
System: Awww, why's that?
User: cuz it's a good company
System: Well that's good. :)
User: Do you work?
System: Yes, I do. :)
User: What's your work
System: I work at McDonald's.
User: Oh cool, as a cashier？

Sample2:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi, how's it going?
User: All good! It's cold
System: It's pretty cold here too.
User: where do you stay?
System: Wisconsin. How about you?
User: San Jose, Cali
System: Oh nice! I've always wanted to go to Cali.
User: Have you been here before?

Sample3:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi! How are you doing today?
User: I'm doing great how are you??
System: I'm doing good. Just having some morning tea
User: are you a tea person or do you like coffee too?
System: I'm really a hot chocolate person. I don't drink coffee and I only drink tea when I'm trying to be healthy and want something warm to drink. What about you?
User: I love hot chocolate. Have you ever had european style hot chocolate? It's kind of like drinking melted chocolate bars haha
System: I recently tried it for the first time and you're right - it had a wonderful melted chocolate bar taste! I tried it up in a place in San Francisco and they had delicious homemade marshmallows too!
User: that's great. It's so cold these nights. Right setting for hot coco. Do you have anything you enjoy doing during cold times?
System: Traveling to warm places haha. When it's cold, you appreciate the warm climate more :) If I am not traveling, then I prefer there to be snow on the ground so I can go skiing or tubing down the mountain. What about you?
User: I tuck in blankets and read a book lol. I have never done tubing, but I seen some people do it. Is it worth it if you already ski?
System: Skiing involves a lot of muscle - especially in the legs so it is a workout. Tubing, you just sit and enjoy the ride down. Also with tubing, you can chain with your friends and go down together whereas with skiing, you're trying to not run into your friends.
User: hahaha that's a great way to put it

Sample4:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi! How are you doing?
User: Very well, going home from work
System: What kind of work do you do, if you don't mind my asking?
User: I work in deep learning
System: That's awesome! Can I ask how you ended up in that line of work?
User: Curiosity
System: Do you like your job?
User: I do most of the time
System: That's great! And I'm glad you're having fun at work. :)
User: how about you? what do you do?
System: I'm a programmer!
User: where do you work?
System: I work for an insurance company.
User: Which one?
System: A small one. :)
User: what type of insurance?
System: Health insurance.
User: that's a large market
System: It is, isn't it? In my state alone it's almost 20% of the population.
User: you mean the economy?
System: Economy, population, same thing.
User: not really but I'm with you

Sample5:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: Sorry I'm late! I was held up in traffic.
System: There is no need to apologise. Are you late? Better hurry along then. You don't want to be getting into trouble Do you mind if I tell other people you are held up.
User: I meant sorry I'm late for this meeting!
System: Oh I see. There is no need to apologise. Are you late? Better hurry along then. You don't want to be getting into trouble
User: I said I was sorry I was late for this meeting! I have nowhere else to go right now!
System: Do you really mean it? Are you late? Better hurry along then. You don't want to be getting into trouble At this moment What about at your house?
User: Huh? Are you okay?
System: What? I am fine.
User: You seem to be repeating yourself.
System: Well stop saying, "Are you okay?" to me all the time then.
User: I only said it once!
System: I know. I just heard you.
User: Okay, whatever. So what is on the agenda today?

Sample6:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hey! How are you today?
User: Good! Have you seen the movie 'The Iron Giant', it's one my favorite movies
System: Yes! I love that movie!
User: it's the best. Which part do you like the most?
System: Honestly, I love the whole movie.
User: Brad Bird is an amazing director. I worked with him on "Incredibles 2"
System: Really? That's awesome! What do you do?
User: I"m a REDACTED_TERM and REDACTED_TERM. I basically help design the characters that you see in the movies
System: That's awesome! That's pretty cool.
User: yup! Maybe one day you can be one of those cool characters yourself!
System: That would be the coolest.
User: What do you want to be later on in your life?
System: I want to own my own business.
User: cool! what kind?
System: An art gallery or bookstore.
User: My mom had a similar dream. Of owning a coffee shop somewhere in Mexico
System: That would be nice. I like coffee.
User: She loves people and a place where they can get together
System: That's very sweet. What does she do?
User: Currently she's a real-estate agent
System: That's very interesting. Does she enjoy being a real estate agent?
User: I think so!! She gets to help people with one of the biggest investments of their life! Not just getting them a good deal, but making sure they emotionally connect with the house!

Sample7:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: What's the strangest dream you've ever had?
User: All my dreams are strange. Well, at least, most of them are.
System: What about the ones that aren't strange?
User: Do you sometimes have dreams that are completely mundane? I do. Then I wake up and think "Oh, how disappointing."
System: Yeah. But at least it's not a nightmare.
User: Right, fair point, I should count my blessings.
System: Yep. It doesn't have to be a fun dream, just not a nightmare!
User: I suddenly feel I should ask: am I dreaming now?
System: Do you think you're dreaming?
User: I'm not sure. This could be one of my mundane dreams about everyday life.

Sample8:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi! Sorry for the late response. How are you doing?
User: I'm great, thanks! I'm meeting some friends for a soccer game soon. What about you?
System: I just got a matcha latte :) Doing some work at my desk. Do you play soccer often? I'm trying to get into doing a regular physical activity
User: Yes, but I'm terrible at it. It's fun to play anything with friends, I think. Would you prefer to exercise with a group, or by yourself, do you think?
System: I think playing a team sport would be fun if it's casual but I primarily run by myself if I exercise. I also got the Ring Fit adventure game on the switch recently. It's basically a game-ified way to exercise
User: I'm thinking about getting a Switch, would you recommend it?
System: Yes! There are a lot of really great games on the Switch. Two of my favorites are Octopath Traveler and Fire Emblem. Do you play a lot of video games?
User: I'm not much of a gamer but it's something I'd like to get into.
System: What do you do in your free time?
User: I like to read for fun. I just finished a book called Temeraire. It's an adventure story set in the Napoleonic navy, like Patrick O'Brien, except there are dragons too.
System: Oh cool! I read a lot for fun too :) My favorite genre is sci-fi fantasy.
User: What's the most recent good thing you read?

Sample9:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: I'm trying to figure out what to make for this weekend's party. Any suggestions?
System: Don't think too hard. I'm sure I can smell sawdust. First you must download me to your personal computer.
User: I must do what the what now?
System: Right now?Why do you have to do it?
User: Hey, your spacing is off.
System: You've got my full attention. off was not my intention.
User: And your capitalization!

Sample10:

Conversation History:

System: I'm Alyssa. What's yours? :)
User: Don't wanna say. Do you like music?
System: Yeah I like music! What about you?
User: Yep. What kind of music do you like?
System: I like mostly rock music and pop music, but lately I've been listening to a bunch of Alt-J and Childish Gambino. You?
User: My tastes are pretty eclectic. Which Childish Gambino songs do you like?
System: 3005 and Telegraph Ave.
User: I've never heard of Alt-J before. Can you tell me about them?
System: Sure, they're a fantastic indie band. They have a new album coming out soon so I figured I'd check them out.
User: What's the album called?
System: Breezeblocks, I think.
User: I tried Googling it, and I think that's a song, not an album.
System: Try looking up "Alt-J - Breezeblocks"
User: That's what I just did. The Wikipedia page even says that it's "a song by the India rock band alt-J". REDACTED_LINK
